study_plan_entry.title: De- and re-regulation of Network Industries

free_text.Learning outcomes: The network industries comprise several important sectors, including water supply, electricity supply, telecommunications and transport industries. The course aims to:[br/]	1) provide an introduction to the emerging managerial, technical and political issues that accompany the liberalization and re-regulation of network industries[br/]	2)explore, with the participants, key research topics in these areas, pertaining, in particular, to the management of network industries, network economics, orgtanizational change, institutional development, and regulation. [br/]
free_text.Content: [li] General principles of sectoral liberalization (deregulation, privatization, unbundling)[br/]	[li] Liberalization policies of the European Union[br/]	[li] Concepts in sectoral regulation (competition, privatization and political regulation)[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the telecommunications sector[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the postal sector[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the railways sector[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the electricity sector[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the air transport sector[br/]	[li] The liberalization/regulation of the water (supply & sanitation) sector[br/]	[li] Challenges to regulation[br/]	[li] Challenges to market evolution[br/]	[li] Challenges to enterprise strategies and management[br/]	[li] Challenges for academic research[br/]
free_text.Keywords: De-regulation, regulation, network industries, privatization, governance[br/]
free_text.Note: The course will be taught every year, alternatively at EPFL, at Paris I, La Sorbonne, and at the Delft University of Technology. To sign up for the course, please contact the EDMT secretariat. [br/]
